item.title: Josh add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "I'd rather be a rising ape than a falling angel." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Josh add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "A European says: I can't understand this, what's wrong with me? An American says: I can't understand this, what's wrong with him? I make no suggestion that one side or other is right, but observation over many years leads me to believe it is true." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Josh add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Over the centuries, mankind has tried many ways of combating the forces of evil... prayer, fasting, good works and so on. Up until Doom, no one seemed to have thought about the double-barrel shotgun. Eat leaden death, demon..." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Josh add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "They called themselves the Munrungs. It meant The People, or The True Human Beings. It's what most people call themselves, to begin with. And then one day the tribe meets some other People or, if it's not been a good day, The Enemy. If only they'd think up a name like Some More True Human Beings, it'd save a lot of trouble later on" -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Josh add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "And what would humans be without love?" RARE, said Death." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Josh add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "What can the harvest hope for, if not for the care of the Reaper Man?" -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Josh add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Josh add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Josh add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Josh add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Josh add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Reality is merely an illusion, albeit a very persistent one." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Josh add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "For instance, on the planet Earth, man had always assumed that he was more intelligent than dolphins because he had achieved so much&mdash;the wheel, New York, wars and so on&mdash;whilst all the dolphins had ever done was muck about in the water having a good time. But conversely, the dolphins had always believed that they were far more intelligent than man&mdash;for precisely the same reasons." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Josh add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Josh add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Remember, if the time should come when you have to make a choice between what is right and what is easy, remember what happened to a boy who was good, and kind, and brave, because he strayed across the path of Lord Voldemort. Remember Cedric Diggory." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Josh add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The fact that we live at the bottom of a deep gravity well, on the surface of a gas covered planet going around a nuclear fireball 90 million miles away and think this to be normal is obviously some indication of how skewed our perspective tends to be." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Josh add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Some humans would do anything to see if it was possible to do it. If you put a large switch in some cave somewhere, with a sign on it saying 'End-of-the-World Switch. PLEASE DO NOT TOUCH', the paint wouldn't even have time to dry." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Josh add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I don't know half of you half as well as I should like; and I like less than half of you half as well as you deserve." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Josh add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "It is said that your life flashes before your eyes just before you die. That is true, it's called Life." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Josh add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Deserves it! I daresay he does. Many that live deserve death. And some that die deserve life. Can you give it to them? Then do not be too eager to deal out death in judgement. For even the very wise cannot see all ends." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Josh add a quote by Garrison Keillor
item.description: "Cats are intended to teach us that not everything in nature has a purpose." -- Garrison Keillor

item.title: Josh add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "I'll be more enthusiastic about encouraging thinking outside the box when there's evidence of any thinking going on inside it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Josh add a quote by Elbert Hubbard
item.description: "A friend is someone who knows all about you and still loves you." -- Elbert Hubbard

item.title: Josh add a quote by Amos Bronson Alcott
item.description: "Stay is a charming word in a friend's vocabulary." -- Amos Bronson Alcott

item.title: Josh add a quote by Elbert Hubbard
item.description: "This will never be a civilized country until we expend more money for books than we do for chewing gum." -- Elbert Hubbard

item.title: Josh add a quote by Elbert Hubbard
item.description: "Never explainâ€•your friends do not need it and your enemies will not believe you anyway." -- Elbert Hubbard

item.title: Josh add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "We have come from God, and inevitably the myths woven by us, though they contain error, will also reflect a splintered fragment of the true light, the eternal truth that is with God. Indeed only by myth-making, only by becoming 'sub-creator' and inventing stories, can Man aspire to the state of perfection that he knew before the Fall. Our myths may be misguided, but they steer however shakily towards the true harbour, while materialistic 'progress' leads only to a yawning abyss and the Iron Crown of the power of evil." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Josh add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Fantasy is escapist, and that is its glory. If a soldier is imprisioned by the enemy, don't we consider it his duty to escape?. . .If we value the freedom of mind and soul, if we're partisans of liberty, then it's our plain duty to escape, and to take as many people with us as we can!" -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Josh add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "An intellectual? Yes. And never deny it. An intellectual is someone whose mind watches itself. I like this, because I am happy to be both halves, the watcher and the watched. "Can they be brought together?" This is a practical question. We must get down to it. "I despise intelligence" really means: "I cannot bear my doubts." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Josh add a quote by David Hume
item.description: "Generally speaking, the errors in religion are dangerous; those in philosophy only ridiculous." -- David Hume

item.title: Josh add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "When we are tired, we are attacked by ideas we conquered long ago." -- Friedrich Nietzsche
